amendment.description: Amendment originally sought to prohibit the use of EPA funds provided for Hazardous Substance Superfund cleanup activities from being used to reimburse those responsible for creating a hazardous waste site for cleanup costs. \ As amended by the Boehlert substitute amendment (A031), the above was replaced with language that prohibits Hazardous Substance Superfund funding from being used to implement any retroactive liability discount reimbursement.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 68 in the Congressional Record of June 25, 1996, to prohibit the use of funds appropriated in the bill for Hazard Substance Superfund cleanup activities to reimbursement those responsible for creating a hazardous hazardous wastes site for the cost of cleaning it up.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Markey amendment (A030) as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
